0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ccode\u003ememcached\u003c/code\u003e is a fully featured Memcached client for Node.js. \u003ccode\u003ememcached\u003c/code\u003e is\nbuilt with scaling, high availability and exceptional performance in mind. We\nuse consistent hashing to store the data across different nodes. Consistent\nhashing is a scheme that provides a hash table functionality in a way that\nadding or removing a server node does not significantly change the mapping of\nthe keys to server nodes. The algorithm that is used for consistent hashing is\nthe same as \u003ccode\u003elibketama\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThere are different ways to handle errors for example, when a server becomes\nunavailable you can configure the client to see all requests to that server as\ncache misses until it goes up again. It's also possible to automatically remove\nthe affected server from the consistent hashing algorithm or provide \u003ccode\u003ememcached\u003c/code\u003e\nwith a failover server that can take the place of the unresponsive server.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen these issues occur the \u003ccode\u003ememcached\u003c/code\u003e client will emit different events where\nyou can subscribe to containing detailed information about the issues.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe client is configurable on different levels. There's a global configuration\nthat you update so all your Memcached clusters will use the same failure\nconfiguration for example, but it's also possible to overwrite these changes per\n\u003ccode\u003ememcached\u003c/code\u003e instance.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eprotocol\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-protocol\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: protocol\" href=\"#protocol\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAs in other databases and message queues, this module uses the ASCII protocol to communicate with\nthe server, which means that you can see what is send over the wire. dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe server locations is designed to work with different formats. These formats\nare all internally parsed to the correct format so our consistent hashing scheme\ncan work with it. You can either use:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003col dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eString\u003c/strong\u003e, this only works if you are running a single server instance\nof Memcached.  It's as easy a suppling a string in the following format:\n\u003ccode\u003ehostname:port\u003c/code\u003e. For example \u003ccode\u003e192.168.0.102:11211\u003c/code\u003e This would tell the client\nto connect to host \u003ccode\u003e192.168.0.102\u003c/code\u003e on port number \u003ccode\u003e11211\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eArray\u003c/strong\u003e, if you are running a single server you would only have to supply\none item in the array.  The array format is particularly useful if you are\nrunning a cluster of Memcached servers. This will allow you to spread the keys\nand load between the different servers. Giving you higher availability\nwhen one of your Memcached servers goes down.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003eObject\u003c/strong\u003e, when running a cluster of Memcached servers, some servers may allocate different amounts of memory, e.g. 128, 512, and 128mb. While by default all servers are equally important and dispatch consistently the keys between the servers (33/33/33%), it is possible to send more keys in servers having more memory. To do so, define an object whose \u003ccode\u003ekey\u003c/code\u003e represents the server location and whose value represents a server weight, the default weight for a server being 1; so, for instance \u003ccode\u003e{ '192.168.0.102:11211': 1, '192.168.0.103:11211': 2, '192.168.0.104:11211': 1 }\u003c/code\u003e distributes 50% of the keys on server 103, but only 25% on 104 and 25% on 102.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ol\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eTo implement one of the above formats, your constructor would look like this:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight The first one inherits of all Memcached server instances\nwhile the second one is client specific and overwrites the globals. To define these options,\nMemcached server uses the same properties:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003emaxKeySize\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e250\u003c/em\u003e, the maximum key size allowed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003emaxExpiration\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e2592000\u003c/em\u003e, the maximum expiration time of keys (in seconds).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003emaxValue\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e1048576\u003c/em\u003e, the maximum size of a value.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003epoolSize\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e10\u003c/em\u003e, the maximum size of the connection pool.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ealgorithm\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003emd5\u003c/em\u003e, the hashing algorithm used to generate the \u003ccode\u003ehashRing\u003c/code\u003e values.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ereconnect\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e18000000\u003c/em\u003e, the time between reconnection attempts (in milliseconds).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etimeout\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e5000\u003c/em\u003e, the time after which Memcached sends a connection timeout (in milliseconds).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eretries\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e5\u003c/em\u003e, the number of socket allocation retries per request.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003efailures\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e5\u003c/em\u003e, the number of failed-attempts to a server before it is regarded as 'dead'.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eretry\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e30000\u003c/em\u003e, the time between a server failure and an attempt to set it up back in service.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eremove\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003efalse\u003c/em\u003e, if \u003cem\u003etrue\u003c/em\u003e, authorizes the automatic removal of dead servers from the pool.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003efailOverServers\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003eundefined\u003c/em\u003e, an array of \u003ccode\u003eserver_locations\u003c/code\u003e to replace servers that fail and\nthat are removed from the consistent hashing scheme.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ekeyCompression\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003etrue\u003c/em\u003e, whether to use \u003ccode\u003emd5\u003c/code\u003e as hashing scheme when keys exceed \u003ccode\u003emaxKeySize\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eidle\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003e5000\u003c/em\u003e, the idle timeout for the connections.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eencoding\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003eutf8\u003c/em\u003e, encoding of data when socket as a readable stream\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eExample usage:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e.command\u003c/strong\u003e This is the core functionality of the \u003ccode\u003ememcached\u003c/code\u003e client. All public API's are\nrouted through this function. It takes care of the argument validations Server\nretrieval ( If the server argument isn't specified ). After all data ready a\nconnection is asked for the private \u003ccode\u003econnect\u003c/code\u003e method and the command is written\nto the Memcached server.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003equery\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003eObject\u003c/em\u003e, The metaData object, see the \u003ccode\u003eCallbacks\u003c/code\u003e section for the\nspecification.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eserver\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003eString\u003c/em\u003e, The server the to connect. This is only needed when the\nmetaData object doesn't contain a key property to retrieve the server from.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003cstrong\u003e.connectionIssue\u003c/strong\u003e A internal function for logging issues with connections. As there can be various\nof ways that an error occurs we need solid issue manager to handle all these\ncases. For example server could crash or the Memcached server could respond with\n\u003ccode\u003eSERVER ERROR \u0026lt;broken\u0026gt;\u003c/code\u003e.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eerror\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003eString\u003c/em\u003e, The actual error message.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eStream\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003enet.Stream\u003c/em\u003e, A reference to the connection stream where the error\noccurred on.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecallback\u003c/code\u003e: \u003cem\u003eFunction\u003c/em\u003e \u003cstrong\u003e(optional)\u003c/strong\u003e, The callback function of a potential\nrequest, it will be marked as cache miss if it was provided\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"memcached.connectionIssue( \u0026quot;Server down\u0026quot;, connectionReference );\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eEach method requires a callback function. Once this function get executed there\nwill be 2 variables applied:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eerror\u003c/code\u003e: A error response if something went wrong while retrieving data from\nthe Memcached server. Depending on the type of request this will either be an\nstring or an Array with multiple errors.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eresponse\u003c/code\u003e: The actual result from the Memcached server. If the response is\n\u003ccode\u003efalse\u003c/code\u003e or \u003ccode\u003eundefined\u003c/code\u003e than a cache miss occurred. Cache misses will also\noccur when there is an error. So you might want to check on errors first.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen we have a successful response, the context of the callback function will\nshift to a metaData object. The metaData object contains all information that we\nused to generate the request for the Memcached server. The metaData object\ncontains the following properties:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003estart\u003c/code\u003e: Date in milliseconds when the request was received\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eexecution\u003c/code\u003e: Total execution time for the request, including response parsing.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecallback\u003c/code\u003e: Reference to the callback function\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etype\u003c/code\u003e: The type of Memcached command\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ecommand\u003c/code\u003e: The compiled command that was send through the sockets\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003evalidate\u003c/code\u003e: The properties of metaData object that needs type validation.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eAnd all the arguments you have send to the method, this depends on the method\nyou have called.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch2 dir=\"auto\"\u003eWhen connection issues occur we send out different notifications using the\n\u003ccode\u003eEventEmitter\u003c/code\u003e protocol. This can be useful for logging, notification and\ndebugging purposes. Each event will receive details Object containing detailed\ninformation about the issues that occurred.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 tabindex=\"-1\" class=\"heading-element\" dir=\"auto\"\u003eDetails Object\u003c/h3\u003e\u003ca id=\"user-content-details-object\" class=\"anchor-element\" aria-label=\"Permalink: Details Object\" href=\"#details-object\"\u003e\u003csvg class=\"octicon octicon-link\" viewBox=\"0 0 16 16\" version=\"1.1\" width=\"16\" height=\"16\" aria-hidden=\"true\"\u003e\u003cpath d=\"m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe details Object contains the various of error messages that caused, the\nfollowing 3 will always be present in all error events:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eserver\u003c/code\u003e: the server where the issue occurred on\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etokens\u003c/code\u003e: a array of the parsed server string in \u003ccode\u003e[port, hostname]\u003c/code\u003e format.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003emessages\u003c/code\u003e: a array containing all error messages that this server received.\nAs messages are added to the array using .push(), the first issue will at the\nbeginning and the latest error at the end of the array.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThe following properties depend on the type of event that is send. If we are\nstill in our retry phase the details will also contain:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003efailures\u003c/code\u003e: the amount of failures left before we mark the server as dead.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etotalFailures\u003c/code\u003e: the total amount of failures that occurred on this server, as when the\nserver has been reconnected after it's dead the \u003ccode\u003efailures\u003c/code\u003e will be rest to\ndefaults and messages will be removed.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eIf the server is dead these details will be added:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etotalReconnectsAttempted\u003c/code\u003e: the total reconnects we have attempted. This is\nthe success and failure combined.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etotalReconnectsSuccess\u003c/code\u003e: the total successful reconnects we have made.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etotalReconnectsFailed\u003c/code\u003e: the total failed reconnects we have made.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003etotalDownTime\u003c/code\u003e: the total down time that was generated. Formula: (\ntotalReconnectsFailed * reconnect_timeout ) + ( totalRetries * retry_timeout).\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"markdown-heading\" dir=\"auto\"\u003e\u003ch3 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z\"\u003e\u003c/path\u003e\u003c/svg\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/div\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eThere are \u003ccode\u003e5\u003c/code\u003e different events that the \u003ccode\u003ememcached\u003c/code\u003e client emits when connection\nissues occur.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cul dir=\"auto\"\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eissue\u003c/code\u003e: a issue occurred on one a server, we are going to attempt a retry next.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003efailure\u003c/code\u003e: a server has been marked as failure or dead.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ereconnecting\u003c/code\u003e: we are going to attempt to reconnect the to the failed server.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003ereconnect\u003c/code\u003e: successfully reconnected to the memcached server.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003cli\u003e\u003ccode\u003eremove\u003c/code\u003e: removing the server from our consistent hashing.\u003c/li\u003e\n\u003c/ul\u003e\n\u003cp dir=\"auto\"\u003eExample implementations:\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003cdiv class=\"highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto\" dir=\"auto\" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content=\"var memcached = new Memcached([ '192.168.0.102:11211', '192.168.0.103:11211' ]);\nmemcached.on('failure', function( details ){ sys.error( \u0026quot;Server \u0026quot; + details.server + \u0026quot;went down due to: \u0026quot; + details.messages.join( '' ) ) });\nmemcached.on('reconnecting', function( details ){ sys.debug( \u0026quot;Total downtime caused by server \u0026quot; + details.server + \u0026quot; :\u0026quot; + details.totalDownTime + \u0026quot;ms\u0026quot;)});\"\u003e\u003cpre\u003e\u003cspan class=\"pl-k\"\u003evar\u003c/span\u003e \u003cspan class=\"pl-s1\"\u003ememcached\u003c/span\u003e itemprop="text"><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h1 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Memcached <a href="http://travis-ci.org/3rd-Eden/memcached" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/6e0ad0c339a97028f2d9fa90e58dd92aa761bee26c9c02bc975331c0ae975d19/68747470733a2f2f7365637572652e7472617669732d63692e6f72672f3372642d4564656e2f6d656d6361636865642e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572" alt="Build Status" data-canonical-src="https://secure.travis-ci.org/3rd-Eden/memcached.svg?branch=master" style="max-width: 100%;"></a></h1><a id="user-content-memcached-" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Memcached " href="#memcached-"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto"><code>memcached</code> is a fully featured Memcached client for Node.js. <code>memcached</code> isbuilt with scaling, high availability and exceptional performance in mind. Weuse consistent hashing to store the data across different nodes. Consistenthashing is a scheme that provides a hash table functionality in a way thatadding or removing a server node does not significantly change the mapping ofthe keys to server nodes. The algorithm that is used for consistent hashing isthe same as <code>libketama</code>.</p><p dir="auto">There are different ways to handle errors for example, when a server becomesunavailable you can configure the client to see all requests to that server ascache misses until it goes up again. It's also possible to automatically removethe affected server from the consistent hashing algorithm or provide <code>memcached</code>with a failover server that can take the place of the unresponsive server.</p><p dir="auto">When these issues occur the <code>memcached</code> client will emit different events whereyou can subscribe to containing detailed information about the issues.</p><p dir="auto">The client is configurable on different levels. There's a global configurationthat you update so all your Memcached clusters will use the same failureconfiguration for example, but it's also possible to overwrite these changes per<code>memcached</code> instance.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">protocol</h3><a id="user-content-protocol" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: protocol" href="#protocol"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">As in other databases and message queues, this module uses the ASCII protocol to communicate withthe server, which means that you can see what is send over the wire. For debugging this is easierfor both the users and the developers however this also means that SASL auth is not supportedbecause it demands the binary protocol.</p><div class="markdown-heading" 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The constructor of the <code>memcached</code> client take 2 different arguments <code>server locations</code> and <code>options</code>. Syntax:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="var Memcached = require('memcached');var memcached = new Memcached(Server locations, options);"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> <span class="pl-v">Memcached</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-en">require</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'memcached'</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-k">var</span> <span class="pl-s1">memcached</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-v">Memcached</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-v">Server</span> <span class="pl-s1">locations</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">options</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Server locations</h3><a id="user-content-server-locations" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Server locations" href="#server-locations"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The server locations is designed to work with different formats. These formatsare all internally parsed to the correct format so our consistent hashing schemecan work with it. You can either use:</p><ol dir="auto"><li><p dir="auto"><strong>String</strong>, this only works if you are running a single server instanceof Memcached.  It's as easy a suppling a string in the following format:<code>hostname:port</code>. For example <code>192.168.0.102:11211</code> This would tell the clientto connect to host <code>192.168.0.102</code> on port number <code>11211</code>.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><strong>Array</strong>, if you are running a single server you would only have to supplyone item in the array.  The array format is particularly useful if you arerunning a cluster of Memcached servers. This will allow you to spread the keysand load between the different servers. Giving you higher availabilitywhen one of your Memcached servers goes down.</p></li><li><p dir="auto"><strong>Object</strong>, when running a cluster of Memcached servers, some servers may allocate different amounts of memory, e.g. 128, 512, and 128mb. While by default all servers are equally important and dispatch consistently the keys between the servers (33/33/33%), it is possible to send more keys in servers having more memory. To do so, define an object whose <code>key</code> represents the server location and whose value represents a server weight, the default weight for a server being 1; so, for instance <code>{ '192.168.0.102:11211': 1, '192.168.0.103:11211': 2, '192.168.0.104:11211': 1 }</code> distributes 50% of the keys on server 103, but only 25% on 104 and 25% on 102.</p></li></ol><p dir="auto">To implement one of the above formats, your constructor would look like this:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="var memcached = new Memcached({ '192.168.0.102:11211': 1, '192.168.0.103:11211': 2, '192.168.0.104:11211': 1 });var memcached = new Memcached([ class="pl-s">'192.168.0.102:11211'</span>: <span class="pl-c1">1</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'192.168.0.103:11211'</span>: <span class="pl-c1">2</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s">'192.168.0.104:11211'</span>: <span class="pl-c1">1</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span schemes. The first one inherits of all Memcached server instanceswhile the second one is client specific and overwrites the globals. To define these options,Memcached server uses the same properties:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>maxKeySize</code>: <em>250</em>, the maximum key size allowed.</li><li><code>maxExpiration</code>: <em>2592000</em>, the maximum expiration time of keys (in seconds).</li><li><code>maxValue</code>: <em>1048576</em>, the maximum size of a value.</li><li><code>poolSize</code>: <em>10</em>, the maximum size of the connection pool.</li><li><code>algorithm</code>: <em>md5</em>, the hashing algorithm used to generate the <code>hashRing</code> values.</li><li><code>reconnect</code>: <em>18000000</em>, the time between reconnection attempts (in milliseconds).</li><li><code>timeout</code>: <em>5000</em>, the time after which Memcached sends a connection timeout (in milliseconds).</li><li><code>retries</code>: <em>5</em>, the number of socket allocation retries per request.</li><li><code>failures</code>: <em>5</em>, the number of failed-attempts to a server before it is regarded as 'dead'.</li><li><code>retry</code>: <em>30000</em>, the time between a server failure and an attempt to set it up back in service.</li><li><code>remove</code>: <em>false</em>, if <em>true</em>, authorizes the automatic removal of dead servers from the pool.</li><li><code>failOverServers</code>: <em>undefined</em>, an array of <code>server_locations</code> to replace servers that fail andthat are removed from the consistent hashing scheme.</li><li><code>keyCompression</code>: <em>true</em>, whether to use <code>md5</code> as hashing scheme when keys exceed <code>maxKeySize</code>.</li><li><code>idle</code>: <em>5000</em>, the idle timeout for the connections.</li><li><code>encoding</code>: <em>utf8</em>, encoding of data when socket as a readable stream</li></ul><p dir="auto">Example usage:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="var memcached = new Memcached('localhost:11211', {retries:10,retry:10000,remove:true,failOverServers:['192.168.0.103:11211']});"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> <span class="pl-s1">memcached</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-v">Memcached</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-s">'localhost:11211'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">{</span><span class="pl-c1">retries</span>:<span class="pl-c1">10</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c1">retry</span>:<span class="pl-c1">10000</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c1">remove</span>:<span class="pl-c1">true</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span><span class="pl-c1">failOverServers</span>:<span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-s">'192.168.0.103:11211'</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto">If you wish to usage</p><p dir="auto"><strong>.connect</strong> Fetches or generates a connection for the given server. The supplied callbackfunction will receive a reference to the connection as argument.If there are issues with the server connection, we are going to respond with cache-miss pattern.</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>server</code>: <em>String</em>, The server that needs a connection, the format must beconfirm the server_locations specification.</li><li><code>callback</code>: <em>Function</em>, The callback function that receives the net.Stre</li></ul><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="memcached.connect( '192.168.0.103:11211', function( err, conn ){  if( err ) throw new Error( err );  console.log( conn.server );});"><pre><span class="pl-s1">memcached</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">connect</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s">'192.168.0.103:11211'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s1">err</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">conn</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-k">if</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s1">err</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-k">throw</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-v">Error</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s1">err</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>  <span class="pl-smi">console</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s1">conn</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-c1">server</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>.multi</strong> A small wrapper function that makes it easier to query multiple Memcachedservers. It will return the location for each key or the complete list ofservers.</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>keys</code>: <em>Array</em> <strong>(optional)</strong>, They keys that needs to be converted to a server.</li><li><code>callback</code>: <em>Function</em>, The callback function for the data, it will be calledfor <strong>each</strong> key. It will be called with 4 arguments:</li></ul><ol dir="auto"><li><code>server</code>: <em>String</em>, The server location.</li><li><code>key</code>: <em>String</em>, The key associated with the server, if you didn't specifykeys, this variable will be undefined.</li><li><code>index</code>: <em>Number</em>, The current index of the loop</li><li><code>total</code>: <em>Number</em>, The total amount server retrieved.</li></ol><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="memcached.multi( false, function( server, key, index, totals ){  if( err ) throw new Error( err );  this.connect( server, function( err, conn ){    console.log( "connection ready" )  })});"><pre><span class="pl-s1">memcached</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">multi</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-c1">false</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s1">server</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">key</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">index</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">totals</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-k">if</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s1">err</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span> <span class="pl-k">throw</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span class="pl-v">Error</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s1">err</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span>  <span class="pl-smi">this</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">connect</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s1">server</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-k">function</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s1">err</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">conn</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>    <span class="pl-smi">console</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">log</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s">"connection ready"</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span>  <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>.command</strong> This is the core functionality of the <code>memcached</code> client. All public API's arerouted through this function. It takes care of the argument validations Serverretrieval ( If the server argument isn't specified ). After all data ready aconnection is asked for the private <code>connect</code> method and the command is writtento the Memcached server.</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>query</code>: <em>Object</em>, The metaData object, see the <code>Callbacks</code> section for thespecification.</li><li><code>server</code>: <em>String</em>, The server the to connect. This is only needed when themetaData object doesn't contain a key property to retrieve the server from.</li></ul><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="memcached.command({  key: 'key', callback: function(){ console.dir( arguments ); },  // validate the arguments  validate: [[ 'key', String ], [ 'callback', Function ]],  // used for the query  type: 'delete',  command: 'delete key'});"><pre><span class="pl-s1">memcached</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">command</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span>  <span class="pl-c1">key</span>: <span class="pl-s">'key'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-en">callback</span>: <span class="pl-k">function</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">{</span> <span class="pl-smi">console</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">dir</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-smi">arguments</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span> <span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>  <span class="pl-c">// validate the arguments</span>  <span class="pl-c1">validate</span>: <span class="pl-kos">[</span><span class="pl-kos">[</span> <span class="pl-s">'key'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-v">String</span> <span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-kos">[</span> <span class="pl-s">'callback'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-v">Function</span> <span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">]</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>  <span class="pl-c">// used for the query</span>  <span class="pl-c1">type</span>: <span class="pl-s">'delete'</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span>  <span class="pl-c1">command</span>: <span class="pl-s">'delete key'</span><span class="pl-kos">}</span><span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><p dir="auto"><strong>.connectionIssue</strong> A internal function for logging issues with connections. As there can be variousof ways that an error occurs we need solid issue manager to handle all thesecases. For example server could crash or the Memcached server could respond with<code>SERVER ERROR <broken></code>.</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>error</code>: <em>String</em>, The actual error message.</li><li><code>Stream</code>: <em>net.Stream</em>, A reference to the connection stream where the erroroccurred on.</li><li><code>callback</code>: <em>Function</em> <strong>(optional)</strong>, The callback function of a potentialrequest, it will be marked as cache miss if it was provided</li></ul><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate position-relative overflow-auto" dir="auto" data-snippet-clipboard-copy-content="memcached.connectionIssue( "Server down", connectionReference );"><pre><span class="pl-s1">memcached</span><span class="pl-kos">.</span><span class="pl-en">connectionIssue</span><span class="pl-kos">(</span> <span class="pl-s">"Server down"</span><span class="pl-kos">,</span> <span class="pl-s1">connectionReference</span> <span class="pl-kos">)</span><span class="pl-kos">;</span></pre></div><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Callbacks</h2><a id="user-content-callbacks" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Callbacks" href="#callbacks"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">Each method requires a callback function. Once this function get executed therewill be 2 variables applied:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>error</code>: A error response if something went wrong while retrieving data fromthe Memcached server. Depending on the type of request this will either be anstring or an Array with multiple errors.</li><li><code>response</code>: The actual result from the Memcached server. If the response is<code>false</code> or <code>undefined</code> than a cache miss occurred. Cache misses will alsooccur when there is an error. So you might want to check on errors first.</li></ul><p dir="auto">When we have a successful response, the context of the callback function willshift to a metaData object. The metaData object contains all information that weused to generate the request for the Memcached server. The metaData objectcontains the following properties:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>start</code>: Date in milliseconds when the request was received</li><li><code>execution</code>: Total execution time for the request, including response parsing.</li><li><code>callback</code>: Reference to the callback function</li><li><code>type</code>: The type of Memcached command</li><li><code>command</code>: The compiled command that was send through the sockets</li><li><code>validate</code>: The properties of metaData object that needs type validation.</li></ul><p dir="auto">And all the arguments you have send to the method, this depends on the methodyou have called.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h2 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Events</h2><a id="user-content-events" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Events" href="#events"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">When connection issues occur we send out different notifications using the<code>EventEmitter</code> protocol. This can be useful for logging, notification anddebugging purposes. Each event will receive details Object containing detailedinformation about the issues that occurred.</p><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Details Object</h3><a id="user-content-details-object" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Details Object" href="#details-object"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">The details Object contains the various of error messages that caused, thefollowing 3 will always be present in all error events:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>server</code>: the server where the issue occurred on</li><li><code>tokens</code>: a array of the parsed server string in <code>[port, hostname]</code> format.</li><li><code>messages</code>: a array containing all error messages that this server received.As messages are added to the array using .push(), the first issue will at thebeginning and the latest error at the end of the array.</li></ul><p dir="auto">The following properties depend on the type of event that is send. If we arestill in our retry phase the details will also contain:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>failures</code>: the amount of failures left before we mark the server as dead.</li><li><code>totalFailures</code>: the total amount of failures that occurred on this server, as when theserver has been reconnected after it's dead the <code>failures</code> will be rest todefaults and messages will be removed.</li></ul><p dir="auto">If the server is dead these details will be added:</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>totalReconnectsAttempted</code>: the total reconnects we have attempted. This isthe success and failure combined.</li><li><code>totalReconnectsSuccess</code>: the total successful reconnects we have made.</li><li><code>totalReconnectsFailed</code>: the total failed reconnects we have made.</li><li><code>totalDownTime</code>: the total down time that was generated. Formula: (totalReconnectsFailed * reconnect_timeout ) + ( totalRetries * retry_timeout).</li></ul><div class="markdown-heading" dir="auto"><h3 tabindex="-1" class="heading-element" dir="auto">Events</h3><a id="user-content-events-1" class="anchor-element" aria-label="Permalink: Events" href="#events-1"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path d="m7.775 3.275 1.25-1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1 4.95 4.95l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1-4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1 .018-1.042.751.751 0 0 1 1.042-.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l2.5-2.5a2.002 2.002 0 0 0-2.83-2.83l-1.25 1.25a.751.751 0 0 1-1.042-.018.751.751 0 0 1-.018-1.042Zm-4.69 9.64a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 2.83 0l1.25-1.25a.751.751 0 0 1 1.042.018.751.751 0 0 1 .018 1.042l-1.25 1.25a3.5 3.5 0 1 1-4.95-4.95l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 0 1 4.95 0 .751.751 0 0 1-.018 1.042.751.751 0 0 1-1.042.018 1.998 1.998 0 0 0-2.83 0l-2.5 2.5a1.998 1.998 0 0 0 0 2.83Z"></path></svg></a></div><p dir="auto">There are <code>5</code> different events that the <code>memcached</code> client emits when connectionissues occur.</p><ul dir="auto"><li><code>issue</code>: a issue occurred on one a server, we are going to attempt a retry next.</li><li><code>failure</code>: a server has been marked as failure or dead.</li><li><code>reconnecting</code>: we are going to attempt to reconnect the to the failed server.</li><li><code>reconnect</code>: successfully reconnected to the memcached server.</li><li><code>remove</code>: removing the server from our consistent hashing.</li></ul><p dir="auto">Example implementations:</p><div class="highlight highlight-source-js notranslate " + details.server + " :" + details.totalDownTime + "ms")});"><pre><span class="pl-k">var</span> <span class="pl-s1">memcached</span> <span class="pl-c1">=</span> <span class="pl-k">new</span> <span (If in Mac env, you can install it via homebrew, and <code>brew services start memcached</code>)</li><li>Start 3 memcached servers at port 11211, 11212, 11213. (You first service will start at default port 11211, so you need to start 2 other servers manually. <code>memcached -p 11212 -d</code>, <code>memcached -p 11213 -d</code>)</li><li>Run <code>export MEMCACHED__HOST=localhost</code> in your terminal.
